description: ** available end October **Hurford Salvi Carr are pleased to offer this superb fully furnished second floor two double bedroom apartment located in one of the area’s most popular developments.This spacious apartment spans in excess of 790 sq ft*, benefits include wooden floors, walk in shower room and en-suite bathroom. One of the great features of this apartment is the large private balcony which offers unrivalled views across Limehouse Marina towards the Canary Wharf skyline.This property is a perfect fit for professional/corporate sharers or a couple who require that extra space. Further benefits are 24hr concierge and a communal garden and a secure underground parking space.Limehouse DLR station is less than a 5 minute walk, offering convenient connections towards Canary Wharf and the City. A Tesco and Sainsburys is located nearby.A prompt internal viewing is highly recommended. />

description: Homesearch is delighted to present the four-bedroom semi-detached property on Acton. A large sitting area, a fully equipped kitchen with gas hob and dishwasher, a double bedroom and a shower room are located on the ground floor. Three double bedrooms, one with an en-suite, and a modern completely tiled family bathroom with a built-in jacuzzi are located upstairs. In addition, the property has a private garden with decking, off-street parking, and laminate flooring throughout.The property is a quiet residential street within walking distance of East Acton's local amenities, which include a diverse selection of shops, cafes, and restaurants, as well as Churchfield Road, which offers a vibrant culinary and retail experience with a slew of independent restaurants, bakeries, and coffee shops.East Acton (Central Line) and Acton Central (Overground) stations are both nearby, as are the lovely Acton Park and Wormwood scrubs. description: HW Estate Agents are delighted to offer for rent a stunning two bedroom, first floor apartment in a period Edwardian conversion. This property has been finished to the highest standard throughout.Entering the property through the long hallway with the first bathroom to your right, fully tiled throughout with underfloor heating with bath and overhead shower. Continue down the hallway into the open plan living and kitchen area completed with integrated oven and induction hob.As you follow the hallway you have the two bedrooms to your left and right. Both bedrooms have great natural light and enough space for a wardrobe. The master bedroom also boasts a newly fitted en-suite bathroom.The property also benefits from underfloor heating in the bathrooms and security alarm system.Available late September and offered furnished or unfurnished.Wilbury Villas is considered a prestigious address in Hove and this flat provides safe and peaceful accommodation to enjoy.Accessible to both Hove and Brighton Station, Hove Rec and Hove Park, the flat is accessible to 7 dials and Church road which provide a wide variety of retails, coffee houses and restaurants.Nearest stations:National Train Station logo Hove (0.4 miles)National Train Station logo Preston Park (0.8 miles)National Train Station logo Aldrington (0.9 miles)The seafront is also a short walk away.Material InformationCouncil Tax Band :B

description: Loddon Properties presents this stunning four bedroom, executive family home to the rental market in the sought after location of Hatch Warren. On approach this family home offers a large frontage with an expansive driveway, providing ample parking for multiple vehicles. As you enter the property you are welcomed by a superb feature central oak and glass staircase. On one side is a formal dining area and the other can be utilised for a family space. The newly fitted kitchen boasts a large breakfast bar, built in oven, hob and cooker hood and plenty of work surfaces with storage cupboards. A perfect entertaining space family and friends. The kitchen also provides entry to the large study or bedroom, separate utility room with more storage space and access to the garage via sliding doors. From the dining area, double doors lead to a generous lounge with bi-folding doors out to the garden, which span the width of the room allowing plenty of natural light to flood inside. Upstairs this beautiful home offers three double bedrooms, a modern family bathroom and built in storage on the landing. The master bedroom has a large en-suite with a further bedroom being used as dressing room with direct access from the master and features fitted double wardrobes. To the rear of the property is a beautifully kept, private enclosed garden which offers a large patio area and lots of space for alfresco dining and entertaining. The remainder of the garden is laid lawn with shrubs in the borders.Holmes Close is located in Hatch Warren which has a good range of facilities including Sainsburys superstore, pharmacy, school and pub. Basingstoke town centre is within a short drive and offers multiple shopping and recreational facilities together with Festival Place shopping precinct, John Lewis at Home, Waitrose, the Anvil Concert Hall, Haymarket Theatre and the mainline station, which offers a regular service to London Waterloo in about 45 minutes. The M3 is within a short drive via junctions 6 or 7.This stunning property is available now, call now for your personal viewing appointment!Let available date: From 16/09/2023deposit: £2,538.46 if offer accepted at £2,200PCMminimum tenancy: 12 Month contract with 6-month break clauselet type: Landlord Flexiblefurnish type: Unfurnishedcouncil tax band: FEPC rating: C

key_features: ['Furnished', 'Leasehold', 'Newly refurbished', 'Bills included', 'Wifi and cleaner provided', 'Shared house', 'Philips Hue lighting', 'Bike storage', 'Ring cameras', 'Modern furniture', 'Work from home space', 'Private garden']
description: We take immense pride in presenting this newly refurbished property nestled on Keynes Road in the charming city of Cambridge. Offering excellent connectivity to the A14 and the town centre, this exquisite four-bedroom house share is the perfect haven for working professionals seeking a tranquil and welcoming place to call home.Within this inviting house share, we offer four meticulously designed rooms. The centrepiece of this dwelling is the stylish and generously spacious living area, thoughtfully designed to serve as a multifunctional space for relaxation, dining, and work. For those who require a dedicated workspace, we provide well-appointed work desks. After a long day¢-²s work, you can unwind on the plush, oversized sofa that eagerly awaits your return.The fully equipped shared kitchen boasts all the essential appliances needed to conjure up culinary delights. Additionally, a convenient utility room is available for laundry needs, offering extra storage space and secure bicycle storage.All bedrooms feature Philips Hue lighting, and the property also benefits from Ring security cameras.All rooms are tastefully furnished with modern, homely accents, ensuring that you can relax in utmost comfort. Each bedroom is thoughtfully adorned with contemporary furniture, a rare gem in most shared accommodations.Room 3Situated on the first floor, is a spacious double room featuring a comfortable bed and mattress. It comes complete with a wardrobe, bedside table, chair, and an elegant chest of drawers, offering scenic views of the enclosed rear garden.Bills are included, subject to a fair use policy, and wifi and a cleaner are provided free of charge.The rear private garden is a true oasis of tranquility and serenity, with mature fruit trees bearing bountiful harvests of juicy fruits. The rear patio offers comfortable seating, inviting you to relax on warm summer nights.We highly recommend scheduling a viewing to experience the charm of this remarkable property firsthand.Please note that each room is suitable for a single working, and we regretfully cannot accommodate couples or students.

description: Brand new refurbished 4 -bedroom flat is an oasis for students and working professionals alike; spread across one floor, it is bright, spacious and just a stone's throw away from Euston, meaning transport links to the heart of London couldn't be any easier to access!A fantastic opportunity to rent in one of London's prime locations, we couldn't be more eager to get this property lived in; with brand new furniture in these fully furnished rooms, a large modern kitchen diner, fully tiled bath bathroom with WC and a separate WC.Euston is described as the heart of the city, and rightly so; with train, tube and bus routes to every crevice of this booming metropolis, London (and beyond) lies at your feet. This focal destination is a stepping stone to unlocking surrounding areas and is perfect whatever your need. For students, it is mere minutes away from the iconic British Library and University of London campuses such as ucl, soas, King's College, Birkbeck, lse and many more - Senate House Library is also easily accessible, presenting you with plenty of quaint study space as well as a plethora of legendary reading material, both classic and contemporary.If a high street is what you're after, what better retail hub to find yourself in than the world famous Oxford Street? Hosting millions of tourists a year, it meets every possible shopping need you could ever have, but if something more lowkey is more your cup of tea, the Brunswick Centre is a treat in all seasons and again, just a 15 minute walk away, based in Russell Square. Some prefer to escape the culture of hustle and bustle, and luckily, there are plenty of parks and green spaces to immerse yourself in when in need of slowing everything down a tad and unwinding - Regents Park is also within walking distance!

description: Loddon Properties are pleased to offer to the rental market this four double bedroom town house. Situated close to local amenities, the property offers versatile accommodation over three floors and comprises of spacious entrance hall, modern kitchen/diner with all appliances included and a door leading out to the private enclosed garden. On the first floor can be found the generous living room with feature electric fireplace, airing cupboard, wc and a double bedroom boasting fitted wardrobes. The second floor hosts three further double bedrooms, two benefiting from fitted wardrobes and a newly fitted family bathroom including shower over bath there is also generous amounts of storage. Finally, there is an integral garage on the ground floor with driveway parking to the front. Additional benefits include gas central heating and double glazing.Popley is a development on the North East of Basingstoke, less than 3 miles from the town centre, Festival Place Shopping and Basingstoke train station, which provides a direct main line service to London Waterloo that takes approx. 45 minutes. The A33 is also accessible within half a mile, giving good road access to Basingstoke, Reading, the M3 and M4 motorways. There is an abundance of local shops, schools, and other facilities including Chineham shopping center, approx.1.5 miles away, home to a variety of stores including Tesco, Marks and Spencer, Boots, Costa Coffee, and much more.This property is available early October, call our team now to arrange your personal viewing appointment!Let available date: From 05/10/2023deposit: £1,730.76 if offer accepted at £1,500PCMminimum tenancy: 12 Month contract with 6 month break clauselet type: Landlord Flexiblefurnish type: Unfurnishedcouncil tax band: CEPC rating: D

key_features: ['Furnished', 'Leasehold', 'Newly refurbished', 'Bills included', 'Wifi and cleaner provided', 'Shared house', 'Philips Hue lighting', 'Bike storage', 'Ring cameras', 'Modern furniture', 'Work from home space', 'Private garden']
description: We take immense pride in presenting this newly refurbished property nestled on Keynes Road in the charming city of Cambridge. Offering excellent connectivity to the A14 and the town centre, this exquisite four-bedroom house share is the perfect haven for working professionals seeking a tranquil and welcoming place to call home.Within this inviting house share, we offer four meticulously designed rooms. The centrepiece of this dwelling is the stylish and generously spacious living area, thoughtfully designed to serve as a multifunctional space for relaxation, dining, and work. For those who require a dedicated workspace, we provide well-appointed work desks. After a long day¢-²s work, you can unwind on the plush, oversized sofa that eagerly awaits your return.The fully equipped shared kitchen boasts all the essential appliances needed to conjure up culinary delights. Additionally, a convenient utility room is available for laundry needs, offering extra storage space and secure bicycle storage.All bedrooms feature Philips Hue lighting, and the property also benefits from Ring security cameras.All rooms are tastefully furnished with modern, homely accents, ensuring that you can relax in utmost comfort. Each bedroom is thoughtfully adorned with contemporary furniture, a rare gem in most shared accommodations.Room 2Situated on the first floor, is a spacious double room featuring a comfortable bed and mattress. It comes complete with a wardrobe, bedside table, chair, and an elegant chest of drawers, offering scenic views of the enclosed rear garden.Bills are included, subject to a fair use policy, and wifi and a cleaner are provided free of charge.The rear private garden is a true oasis of tranquility and serenity, with mature fruit trees bearing bountiful harvests of juicy fruits. The rear patio offers comfortable seating, inviting you to relax on warm summer nights.We highly recommend scheduling a viewing to experience the charm of this remarkable property firsthand.Please note that each room is suitable for a single working, and we regretfully cannot accommodate couples or students.

description: A beautiful two storey Victorian terraced family house nestled within this popular residential road in Dartmouth Park just moments from Parliament Hill Fields. The house features a modern fully fitted kitchen/breakfast room and bathroom suite and a good standard of decoration throughout. There are three double bedrooms, a double reception room and secluded rear garden. Available around 31st October. Unfurnished.Ground FloorEntrance HallCoconut matting, carpet, dado rail, coving, under stairs storage cupboard.Through Reception RoomFront and rear reception rooms separated by large double doors. Both rooms feature a cast iron fireplace with marble surround, high ceiling, stripped and varnished wood flooring, ceiling rose, picture rail. Single sash window to rear room, sash window to front bay window and low level storage cupboard in the front room.Kitchen Breakfast RoomFitted kitchen with extensive range of floor and wall cupboards to include a full length pull out pantry cupboard, wooden work tops incorporating a single stainless steel sink and drainer unit with mixer tap, stainless steel 'Neff' gas hob with electric oven below and overhead stainless steel extractor canopy, 'Bosch' 50/50 split fridge freezer, 'Zanussi' washing machine, 'Zanussi' tumble dryer, integrated 'Neff' dishwasher, tiled floor, door to garden, inset spotlights, cupboard housing gas central heating boiler, double casement window to rear, sash window to the side.CloakroomLow flush WC, small window, small wash basin with tiled splash back, fitted mirror, tiled floor, radiator.MezzanineBedroom ThreeSingle sash window to rear, carpet.BathroomBathroom suite comprising of tiled panelled bath with wall mounted mixer taps and hand held shower unit mounted on adjustable height fitting, shower screen, low flush WC with concealed cistern, circular wash basin, wall mounted mirror fronted cabinet, chrome heated towel rail, tiled floor, double glazed window, extractor fan, fan light window above bathroom door.Top FloorCarpeted landing, access to loft.Bedroom OneCarpet, sash windows to front, picture rail, cast iron fireplace with painted surround, low level fitted storage cupboard.Bedroom TwoSash window to front, carpet, picture rail, fireplace opening with brick inlay.Rear GardenPrivate and secluded north west facing rear garden mainly paved and with shrub borders.Additional InformationCamden Council Tax Band FHolding deposit required is 1 x weeks rent (£950)Full deposit required is 5 x weeks rent (£4,750)

description: Discover a well-proportioned studio apartment on the sixth floor of a beautiful red-brick building in the heart of Mayfair, neighbouring Berkeley Square.🏙️ Property DescriptionThis studio apartment offers a spacious living area, a modern bathroom, and a unique kitchenette with access to a private gated communal garden.Hill Street boasts generous living space, a convenient lift service, an on-site building manager, and sits nestled between Hyde Park and Green Park.🚆 Great Transport LinksEnjoy excellent transport links with Green Park, Bond Street, and Marble Arch stations just a short stroll away.💰 Financial SummaryHolding Deposit: £600 (1 week’s rent - deducted from the total security deposit)Security Deposit: £2,000 (1 calendar month’s rent, less holding deposit)Monthly Rent: £2,600Total Payment: £5,200🏡 Hill StreetHill Street resides in the heart of Mayfair, with number 39 being an Art Deco apartment block offering studios, one, two, and three-bedroom apartments. description: Property Reference: 1827871.Feel at home in this bright and spacious 2 bedroom flat in Maida Vale Close to Maida Vale tube station, a local bus hub and Paddington Recreation ground with its excellent athletic and recreational facilities, this flat offers modern amenities such as a beautiful sit-in kitchen with built-in appliances (hob/oven, dishwasher, fridge freezer, washing machine/dryer, wine cooler) as well as many traditional features (coving, high skirtings and fireplaces). The decor is a stylish grey with wooden or tiled flooring throughout; the two large bedrooms are carpeted. letting_details: ['Deposit:£1,673', 'Deposit:', '£1,673', 'Council tax band:Not available', 'Council tax band:', 'Not available', '', 'Letting arrangements:Not available', 'Letting arrangements:', 'Not available']
key_features: ['Unfurnished', 'Four Bedrooms House', 'Large Garden', 'Downstairs Shower Room', 'Gas Central Heating', 'Freshly Painted', 'New Carpets', 'Driveway Parking']
description: This four-bedroom residence boasts an exceptionally spacious plot, characterized by expansive gardens and ample driveway parking. The property's ground floor has undergone substantial extensions, enhancing its living space significantly. Furthermore, it has recently undergone a comprehensive renovation, featuring fresh paintwork and the installation of brand-new carpets throughout. Martin & Co are delighted to present this generously proportioned and tastefully extended four-bedroom residence, ideally situated in a serene yet highly sought-after locale, complete with convenient off-street parking. The property has recently had revitalization, boasting brand-new carpets and a fresh coat of paint throughout.Upon entering, the ground floor reveals a shower room, thoughtfully complemented by a separate cloakroom for added convenience. The pièce de résistance, however, is the expansive rear garden, an idyllic retreat for outdoor enthusiasts.This exceptional property enjoys an enviable proximity to various amenities, with the Town Centre, Festival Place shopping center, and the rail station mere moments away, granting effortless access to London in approximately 50 minutes. Entertainment options abound, including nearby cinemas, and major retail giants like Tesco and Morrison are easily accessible. For those commuting by car, the motorway links are a short drive away, ensuring seamless connectivity.Furthermore, the residence is positioned within a mere five-minute stroll from two primary schools and a junior school, as well as The Vyne Community School, making it an ideal choice for families seeking educational convenience.In summary, this property comes very highly recommended, offering a harmonious blend of space, style, and superb accessibility in the desirable locale of Basingstoke.Front door to entrance hall Stairs to first floor with storage cupboards under, radiator, cupboard housing fuse-boxlounge 9' 10" x 9' 10" (3.02m x 3.01m) Front aspect window and radiator. Arch leading tostudy 11' 3" x 6' 5" (3.45m x 1.96m) Panelled walls and radiator.Dining room 13' 1" x 10' 9" (3.99m x 3.3m) Radiator, airing cupboardkitchen 14' 9" x 7' 6" (4.52m x 2.29m) Rear aspect and double glazed door to garden. Stainless steel sink unit with single drainer with cupboard and drawers under, further range of cupboards and drawers. Space and plumbing for washing machine, wall mounted gas boiler.Inner hall Skylight windowshower room Shower cubicle with electric shower and radiator.Cloakroom Side aspect window, pedestal wash hand basin, low-level W.C and radiator.Bedroom 4 11' 0" x 9' 7" (3.36m x 2.94m) Dual aspect windows and radiator.First floor landing Front aspect windowbedroom 1 11' 10" x 9' 8" (3.62m x 2.95m) Rear aspect window, radiator and fitted wardrobesbedroom 2 11' 9" x 9' 10" (3.60m x 3.02m) Rear aspect window, radiatorbedroom 3 7' 4" x 6' 8" (2.25m x 2.05m) Front aspect window, radiator and built in wardrobebathroom Rear aspect window. Panelled enclosed bath, low level W.C, pedestal wash hand basin, radiator and part-tiled wallsoutside front Driveway parking for two cars, large front garden laid to lawnrear Large rear garden, mostly laid to lawn. Rear gate accessapplications A holding deposit equivalent to 1 weeks rent will be required to reserve the property while referencing checks are being carried out. With the tenants' consent this holding deposit will be refunded against the first month's rent. The holding deposit can be retained if the applicant provides false or misleading information, fails Right to Rent checks, withdraws from the property or fails to take reasonable steps to enter into the tenancy.In accordance with the Tenant Fees Act applicants will be required to enter into the tenancy agreement no more than 15 days after paying the holding deposit. Failure to do so for any of the afore mentioned reasons may result in you losing your holding deposit. An extension to the deadline may be entered into if agreed in writing by all parties.PetIf a tenancy is agreed to include a pet, an additional £50 per month in rent will be payable for the duration or the tenancy.Right to Rent ChecksBy law, Right to Rent checks must be carried and as such will be required to provide proof of id and address in accordance with Home Office guidelines. More information can be found at:Reference Checks and Credit WorthinessAll applicants will be subject to a credit check carried out by a 3rd party to check for CCJs and IVAs Applicants will need to provide proof of an income of at least 2.5 x annual rent.We will also carry out employment checks, affordability checks, previous landlord reference and proof of address history, usually up to 3 years.Documentation that will be requiredPassport, driving licence, utility bill dated in the last 3 months (for proof of address) and payslipsmaterial information Council Tax Band: CEPC rating DMinimum Tenancy Term 12 MonthsRent: £1,450 per monthDeposit: £1673unfurnished

key_features: ['Unfurnished', 'Bright and spacious with high ceilings', 'Large west-facing private garden with storage', 'Walking distance to Hove train station & George Street', 'Ample storage space', 'Contemporary and modern feel throughout', 'Plumbing for a washing machine and space for fridge/freezer', 'Minimum 6 month fixed term tenancy', 'One weeks rent to secure the property', 'Available 18th October 2023!', 'Click here for the video tour:']
description: Click here for the video tour!Situated in the heart of Hove, this beautiful one-bedroom lower ground floor flat benefits from its own private large garden. The property has a modern and contemporary feel throughout and consists of a large lounge, separate kitchen, good-sized double bedroom, bathroom and a garden. Located at the front of the property is the lounge area which features big bay windows and high ceilings, creating a bright and spacious feel.Towards the back of the property is the galley kitchen which comes equipped with an integrated oven, gas hob and plumbing for a washing machine and space for a fridge/freezer, and a fully tiled bathroom featuring an elegant white suite including a bath and overhead shower as well as a heated towel rail. The good-sized double bedroom is also located at the rear of the property and benefits from two separate built in wardrobes and French doors leading out onto the west facing garden.The garden is separated by two levels with a patio area at the bottom and large grassy area all the way to the back. There is plenty of storage within the property with two storage cupboards in the hallway and an outhouse in the garden. Located in the highly sought-after central Hove area, there is easy access to nearby shopping facilities, restaurants, cafes and bars on Church Road and George Street. Hove Mainline Railway Station is within a few minutes walk, offering direct access to Gatwick, London and Brighton. There are also frequent buses providing easy access to the rest of the city. Early viewing recommended.Should the landlord agree to a cat or dog in the property, the rent will increase by £25 per month. This will in turn increase the deposit accordingly (5 weeks rent).EPC C. GCH. U/F. Council Tax Band A. Parking zone N. For Google Maps the postcode is BN3 3RQ.

description: We are pleased to bring to the market a rare opportunity to let a well presented 5 bedroom semi-detached house in Christs Hospital. The property consists of 4 double bedrooms and a single bedroom, 3 bathrooms set over 3 storeys. There is a large lounge area on the ground floor which opens up into a bright and airy orangery with the garden to the rear. Downstairs also has a spacious open plan kitchen/dining room and utility room. On the first floor there is the master bedroom with an en-suite shower room and an impressive walk in his and hers wardrobe with a further two bedrooms and family bathroom. The top floor has an additional two double bedrooms.Additional benefits include gas central heating, close proximity to the train station and Christ Hospitals School with pets considered.Available now!

The property is close on hand for an array of local amenities (i.e shops, pubs/eateries, schooling) and a short drive to Braintree's town centre, Braintree Designer Village and stations, which offer a more comprehensive range of facilities. UPVC window to rear.Bedroom One (3.65 > 3.12 x 2.69 (11'11" > 10'2" x 8'9"))Carpet flooring, UPVC window to front. Electric radiator. description: A contemporary ground floor apartment with secure parking forming part of the highly desirable Ryewood development. The property is situated within genuine walking distance of Dunton Green rail station as well as the local parade of shops.Superbly presented, the generously proportioned accommodation comprises entrance hall, spacious sitting/dining room which shares an open plan relationship to the kitchen, two double bedrooms, en suite shower room to the master bedroom and luxuriously appointed bathroom. Additional benefits include allocated parking in a gated courtyard and use of the residents only on site gymnasium.Entrance HallSpacious and welcoming entrance hallway has entrance door with spyhole, radiator, inset downlighting, attractive wood effect flooring, double doors to usefully spacious hall closet and door to utility / boiler closet with space and plumbing for washer dryer.Sitting/Dining RoomSpacious dual aspect reception room has double glazed window to front with accompanying double glazed sliding patio door to side with Juliet style guard rail. Attractive wood effect flooring, pendant lighting, two double radiators, points for satellite/television/radio and telephone. Shares fully open plan social relationship with the kitchen area.KitchenDouble glazed window to side, inset downlighting, tiled flooring and a comprehensive L-shaped series of contemporary wall and base units set with work surface tops and matching splashbacks. Inset 11⁄2 bowl stainless steel sink unit complete with filtered drinking water tap. Integrated appliances include oven with matching microwave, four ring gas hob and overhead extractor, dishwasher and fridge over freezer.Master BedroomDouble bedroom has double glazed window to front, radiator, pendant light, attractive wood effect flooring, built in double wardrobe with sliding mirrored fronts and points for satellite/television/radio and telephone. Door providing access to en suite shower room.En Suite Shower RoomHeated towel rail, inset downlighting, tiled flooring with part tiled walls and contemporary white suite comprising walk in shower with glass screen, concealed flush wc and wall mounted wash basin. Inset bathroom cabinet with double mirrored doors, courtesy light and shaver point.Bedroom TwoDouble bedroom has double glazed window to front, radiator, attractive wood effect flooring, built in double wardrobe with sliding mirrored fronts and points for satellite/television/radio and telephone.BathroomHeated towel rail, inset downlighting, tiled floor and part tiled walls for contrast. Contemporary white suite comprising panelled bath with wall mounted shower unit and screen, concealed flush wc and wall mounted wash basin. Inset bathroom cabinet with mirrored front, courtesy light and shaver point.ParkingOne allocated parking space.Residents Gym And WoodlandThere is a private on-site gymnasium which is exclusive to residents of the Ryewood development. In addition, there is an area of private woodland for the residents use as well as multiple seating areas and children’s play areas within the attractively landscaped gardens and grounds.Other InformationCouncil tax: Band C.

description: Purpose built in 1959 by The Dulwich Estate this flat has been lovingly maintained and refurbished by its current owners. The property is set on the 2nd floor and benefits from lift access. The property is filled with natural light.The lounge is a fantastic size with newly fitted carpets and benefits from excellent light flow all day long from large windows.The well proportioned separate kitchen features a large store cupboard which is 3ft deep giving ample kitchen storage, built in white goods including, fridge/freezer and dishwasher.Both of the double bedrooms are of good proportions with fitted wardrobes. Carpeted and pleasant views. The hallway also includes some storage space! Something that can be easily overlooked.The bathroom is modern, with a bath/shower finished with white tiling.Glenhurst Court is in a remarkably quiet & peaceful location within The Dulwich Estate. If you are commuting, Gipsy Hill & Sydenham Hill train stations are a 10-15 minute walk with circa -30mins trains to Blackfriars, Clapham Junction, London Bridge, and Victoria Train Station. Local bus stops service multiple destinations including Brixton, Crystal Palace and beyond.There is a great selection of local & private schools catering for all ages with many rated Ofsted Outstanding. Crystal Palace Park & Dulwich Wood are close by.With all of the above mentioned, this is a fantastic property. Properties in this location with a high-quality finish are rarely seen on the market.EPC Rating = C | Council Tax Band = C

description: Unique Design – Designer Interior – Stunning Vaulted Atrium Ceiling – Two Luxurious Double Bedrooms – Modern Open Plan Living – Trendy Private Bar Area – Top of the Range Appliances – Permit Parking – Roof Terraces and Patio.This fantastic, bright and modern house, is offered to the market in superb condition and benefits from a unique designer interior throughout. Entering the receiving hallway, the property has a grand staircase with a vaulted atrium style ceiling and leads through to a luxurious open plan reception room with a kitchen featuring top of the range integrated appliances including a dishwasher and double oven gas stove, a trendy bar area with attractive exposed brickwork and doors leading out to the well maintained private patio. The first double bedroom has deluxe built-in wardrobes and a private bathroom with a jacuzzi bathtub, whilst the second double bedroom, located on the first floor has a private en-suite shower room, built-in wardrobes and a private balcony area with stunning views. This exclusive and private home, further benefits from an additional living room / study area on the first floor, with access to the second roof terrace, wooden flooring throughout, skylights, permit parking and high quality electric shutters and alarm systems. Offered furnished / unfurnished, the property is available for immediate occupation.Situated in a prime London location, Tadema Road is moments away from the picturesque River Thames and Chelsea Harbour. Ideally placed for access to both Kings Road and Fulham Road, transport links including the District and Overground mainline are all easily accessible. With numerous charming local shops, bars, cafes and restaurants nearby, you will be spoilt for choice.

description: Introducing this beautiful two bedroom ground floor apartment available to let. With its own entrance and set within the impressive gated development of Theydon Bower, Epping, this is a fabulous place to call home.From the off this place get’s a big tick. There’s allocated parking, a garage en-bloc and you’re just moments away from Epping station. And the inside is just as impressive. This beautifully spacious apartment offers the perfect blank canvas for your furniture to fit right in. We absolutely love the lounge / diner with its gorgeous green views, wood flooring, sash windows and plantation shutters. The kitchen is just as lovely. Full of soft grey shaker cabinetry and integrated appliances, it’s a great spot to cook weekday meals. Both double bedrooms are great sized doubles, with the master comprising its own en-suite shower room. Completing this home, the family bathroom is again beautifully stylish with sleek tiling and spacious vanity unit.Located just off Bower Hill, Theydon Bower is a great place to be. For commuters, easy access to Epping tube is of course a huge bonus. What’s more, you’ve also tons of places to explore locally. The high street is just a short walk away and is replete with great cafe’s, restaurants and shops. description: Important Note to Potential Purchasers & Tenants:We endeavour to make our particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. The services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All photographs and measurements have been taken as a guide only and are not precise. Floor plans where included are not to scale and accuracy is not guaranteed. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Potential purchasers: Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller. description: Henry Adams is pleased to be offering this characterful and bright apartment within this converted Edwardian house. This apartment is located just over 1/2 mile from the High Street and boasts attractive communal gardens that are flanked by woodland. The apartment benefits from a private entrance on the first floor leading to an attractive hall, giving access to all rooms, including a spacious sitting/dining room; modern kitchen with delightful views to the rear; two double bedrooms and a well appointed bathroom. The apartment has one allocated parking space and there is ample visitors' parking. The property is offered on a part furnished basis and is available in September 2023. EPC C.Local AreaHaslemere's close proximity to London has made this lovely town hugely popular with commuters. Waterloo is just 49 minutes by train and travelling by car is just as easy with the A3 on our doorstep.However, its greatest allure is our beautiful properties; we have more than 100 listed buildings in Haslemere alone making this a commuter town with a strong sense of history. You'll find substantial detached family homes, generous gardens and attractive apartments with amazing views over the beautiful English countryside. Haslemere as an area is blessed with excellent state and private schooling, catering for all ages through to sixth form.You'll find a good selection of places to eat and drink in the town, from pubs and cafés to independent restaurants and popular chains with plenty more cosy pubs to be discovered in the surrounding villages.

key_features: ['Furnished', 'Leasehold', 'Newly refurbished', 'Bills included', 'Wifi and cleaner provided', 'Shared house', 'Philips Hue lighting', 'Bike storage', 'Ring cameras', 'Modern furniture', 'Work from home space', 'Private garden']
description: We take immense pride in presenting this newly refurbished property nestled on Keynes Road in the charming city of Cambridge. Offering excellent connectivity to the A14 and the town centre, this exquisite four-bedroom house share is the perfect haven for working professionals seeking a tranquil and welcoming place to call home.Within this inviting house share, we offer four meticulously designed rooms. The centrepiece of this dwelling is the stylish and generously spacious living area, thoughtfully designed to serve as a multifunctional space for relaxation, dining, and work. For those who require a dedicated workspace, we provide well-appointed work desks. After a long day's work, you can unwind on the plush, oversized sofa that eagerly awaits your return.The fully equipped shared kitchen boasts all the essential appliances needed to conjure up culinary delights. Additionally, a convenient utility room is available for laundry needs, offering extra storage space and secure bicycle storage.All bedrooms feature Philips Hue lighting, and the property also benefits from Ring security cameras.All rooms are tastefully furnished with modern, homely accents, ensuring that you can relax in utmost comfort. Each bedroom is thoughtfully adorned with contemporary furniture, a rare gem in most shared accommodations.Room 1Situated on the ground floor, is an exceptionally spacious double room featuring a comfortable bed with an orthopaedic mattress. It's the largest bedroom in the house and comes complete with a wardrobe, bedside table, sofa, and an elegant work desk, offering scenic views of the enclosed rear garden. Furthermore, this room boasts the privilege of having its own private bathroom.Bills are included, subject to a fair use policy, and wifi and a cleaner are provided free of charge.The rear private garden is a true oasis of tranquility and serenity, with mature fruit trees bearing bountiful harvests of juicy fruits. The rear patio offers comfortable seating, inviting you to relax on warm summer nights.We highly recommend scheduling a viewing to experience the charm of this remarkable property firsthand.Please note that each room is suitable for a single working, and we regretfully cannot accommodate couples or students.

The bedrooms each have black-out curtains, double beds with a good quality mattress' - all you need in terms of furniture including mirrors.Rarely needed but when it is the heating is super efficient.Transport:There are many options for transport to choose from - a walk to London Bridge with national rail and tube connections, great connection through the Jubilee line via Bermondsey underground or alternatively many bus routes running up old Kent road into the city.The Area:There are many local amenities, including a Tesco megastore 5 minute walk away, B&Q, Argos and other supermarkets such as Lidl.The area also boasts many great places to hang out right on your door step, from Maltby Street Market where you can find craft micro-breweries, bakers, amazing street food and trendy bars and eateries Borough Market is just down the road by London Bridge & The Shard where you can experience the very best UK produce stalls and exotic street foods. description: Property Reference: 1825323.Modern one bedroom apartment situated in a highly desirable Hove locationThe apartment is situated on the third floor and is conveniently located just two minutes walk from Hove train station, close to local shops, the beach and a bus stop right outside the main entrance with transport links across the city.The apartment has a double bedroom, a bathroom, a lounge and a separate kitchen.Additional benefits include a passenger lift, Pet friendly (one pet per apartment - rules apply), free parking - first-come first-served basis - and an onsite Resident Manager. The apartment is professionally managed on behalf of a long standing and respected property company which owns the whole building and have been operating it as a private rented concern for over 20 years. A reduced deposit of £1,000 only is required.The rent is based on a 12 month tenancy and occupation taken by 11th October. Variable rents and tenancy lengths are available. There is an additional monthly charge of £40 towards seasonal heating and constant hot water. description: A unique and wonderfully spacious apartment in this quietly located and imaginatively converted warehouse close to Wapping Station.The apartment has a large reception room which is ideal for entertaining. It has a great sound and lighting system installed. The kitchen is perfect for the serious cooking enthusiast, with ample work surfaces and excellent equipment. The apartment comes with the great benefit of two secure underground parking spaces.The area is steeped in history, has delightful cobbled streets and many interesting restaurants and river side pubs. Tower Hill and the City of London are within walking distance. The nearest transport links are Wapping Overland station and the DLR and underground at Tower Hill.

title: 5 bed detached house to rent

key_features: ['Unfurnished', 'Sought-after village location, within easy reach of rail station, A3 and M25', 'Immaculately presented and spacious family accommodation', '5 bedrooms (2 en suite) and family bathroom', 'Light and airy kitchen/dining room with range of built-in appliances', 'Wood and tiled floors on ground floor', 'Ample off-street parking', 'Manageable garden offering plenty of privacy and seclusion', 'Close to a range of local shops and a post office', 'Nearby to excellent schools including Howard of Effingham and Manor House']
description: An immaculately presented and spacious modern family home in A sought-after village location, within easy reach of rail station, schools, park and local amenities.This superb modern property is situated in the popular and sought-after village of Effingham in the heart of Surrey. Offering immaculate and spacious accommodation, this lovely family home is within easy reach of the village centre, which has a range of local shops and a post office. The property benefits from wood and tiled floors on the ground floor and carpeting on the first floor. There is an attractive fireplace in the living room and double glazed doors lead into the garden. The light and airy kitchen/dining room is fully fitted with a range of built-in appliances and a glazed door that takes you into the side access. Also on the ground floor is a study with fitted cabinetry and the accessible guest bedroom with an en suite shower roomJust off the reception hall is the downstairs cloakroom while stairs takes you up to the well-proportioned galleried first floor landing, which leads to four double bedrooms and the part-tiled family bathroom, which has a white suite, heated towel rail and a good sized independent shower cubicle with glass door.Outside, there is ample off-street parking on the tarmac driveway at the front of the property. Double gates to the left lead to the manageable rear garden, which features a paved terrace and a large lawned area that is bordered by wood fence panels and well-established trees and hedges. The garden provides a high degree of privacy and seclusion.Schooling in the area is excellent and includes the Howard of Effingham School, St Lawrence and Manor House schools, all within a short distance. Also nearby are St Teresa’s School, Cranmore School, The Raleigh School, Guildford County School, Pond Meadow School, Claremont Fan Court School, Milbourne Lodge, St John’s School and Therfield School. Within walking distance is Effingham Golf Club and the King George V playing fields. Effingham railway station is a few minutes drive and offers regular services to London Waterloo (approximately 45 minutes) while the A3 and M25 motorway are within easy reach, leading to central London, Heathrow and Gatwick airports, and the South Coast.

key_features: ['Entrance hall', 'Kitchen/dining room', 'Reception room', 'Sitting room', 'Master bedroom with en suite', '5 further bedrooms, 2 with en suites', 'Family bathroom', 'South-West facing rear garden', '3,200 sq.ft. Of accommodation', 'Gated development']
description:
This impressive 6 bedroom semi-detached family home was constructed by award winning house builder Octagon in 2011. Located on the slopes of St. George's Hill and set back in a gated development of only 5 similar houses, this delightful home offers modern and bright living accommodation in an exclusive and convenient location.The accommodation, arranged over three floors comprises a bright and airy kitchen, dining and family living room, with 2 sets of double doors opening out to the landscaped West facing gardens. There is also a further reception room, cloakroom and direct access to the garage on this floor.The first floor offers 3 large bedroom suites and the second floor offers 3 further bedrooms and a separate shower room.

To the rear, the garden is principally laid to lawn and a paved patio provides superb ‘al fresco’ dining and relaxation space.

The location is ideal for the local shops, restaurants, bars and boutiques of Queens Road as well as Weybridge station being close by providing access to London Waterloo in around 30 minutes.The A3 is a short drive away providing convenient access to central London and the M25 which, in turn, leads to the national motorway network as well as Heathrow and Gatwick airports.Schooling in the area is excellent and includes a varied selection of both state and private schools including the acs Cobham International School, Claremont Fan Court School in Esher and St George's College and Junior School in Weybridge.

description: The property: A stunning four bedroom detached family home with a garage located in a quiet cul-de-sac. Accessed via an enclosed porch the accommodation here comprises a well proportioned living room which leads through to the separate dining room and luxury kitchen which is fitted with stylish units, a central island and a walk-in pantry. There is a downstairs cloakroom, access in to the integral garage and wood effect flooring laid in a herringbone pattern flowing throughout. On the first floor there are four bedrooms along with a modern family bathroom where there is a shower over the bath. Three of the bedrooms also benefit from built-in storage. Externally the rear garden offers a large area of decking, an expanse of lawn and secure parking behind gates. There is further off road parking at the front of the property. Available immediately.The location: Situated in a sought after position, adjacent to Amherst Gardens and within walking distance to local shops at Bohemia Road, Linton Gardens and Alexandra Park. Hastings Town centre is also just a short stroll away offering shopping and leisure facilities, a mainline railway station and access to the beach.

description: Detailed DescriptionA contemporary two-bedroom apartment over 2 floors in an exciting development situated at the top end of Brick Lane and benefitting from a security video entry system, doubled glazing, gas central heating. The property also consists of its own entrance and is ideally located in the desirable Spitalfields area, whilst also benefitting from close proximity to the City. This well-maintained flat consists of a huge 46m² living area with an open planned fitted kitchen. Double bedrooms - master room with its own en-suite shower room - both are carpeted. Limestone tiled bathroom featuring a circular washbasin on a walnut vanity washstand, chrome towel rail and a huge mirror. The flat is within walking distance of The Truman Brewery, great Indian restaurants, trendy bars & clubs and a 24-hour bagel shop. At the weekend the area comes alive with its vibrant markets of Brick Lane, Spitalfields and Petticoat Lane. In terms of transportation Eagleworks is within close proximity to Shoreditch, Liverpool St and Aldgate East (zone 1), with reliable bus routes, day & night, to the City and West End - Victoria Station via West End (8), London Bridge via Bank (48) & Paddington via Kings Cross (205).

description: Detailed DescriptionHomesforth are proud to offer this very well presented one bedroom raised ground floor flat enviably situated in an attractive period style property in the heart of Stoke Newington. Boasting a wealth of character appeal, the property offers light and spacious, well-planned accommodation with stylish interior throughout. Features include an inviting reception room, modern bathroom and high ceilings throughout.The property is enviably located in a much sought-after residential road in the heart of Stoke Newington, within easy access of Stoke Newington and Rectory Road stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes to Kings Cross and Oxford Street. Stoke Newington offers an array of shops and amenities, with Stoke Newington Church Street providing a wonderful variety of fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants. The area is well served by beautiful open spaces including nearby Clissold Park, Abney Park and Woodberry Wetlands. The property is also located a minutes' walk away from Clissold Leisure Centre which has a swimming pool, squash courts and a large gym.

title: 2 bed flat to rent
letting_details: ['Deposit:£1,500', 'Deposit:', '£1,500', 'Council tax band:Not available', 'Council tax band:', 'Not available', '', 'Letting arrangements:Not available', 'Letting arrangements:', 'Not available']

description: DescriptionOffered for rental on a twelve-month assured shorthold tenancy agreement, a modern two large bedroom ground floor flat with modern lvt floors laid throughout. There is a garden and parking for two vehicles. The property is set in a quiet cul de sac providing easy access to the M23 and main line railway stations servicing London, Gatwick, Brighton and surrounding areas.* Neutrally decorated throughout* Modern lvt floors throughout* Recently installed Worcester Bosh boiler for maximum energy efficiency* Entrance with security entry phone system* Central heating throughout* Double glazed windows throughout* Private entrance hall* Plenty of built-in storage cupboards and wardrobes* Separate cupboard for washing machine* Spacious double aspect living/dining room* Kitchen with integrated appliances with wall mounted Worcester Bosch Boiler* Master bedroom with door leading to garden overlooking woodland beyond and large en-suite shower room* Further double bedroom* Bathroom* Car port with parking for two vehicles and visitors parking* Recessed spotlights, gas fired central heating and UPVC framed double glazing* Council Tax Band 'C' and EPC 'C'This modern, neutrally decorated spacious two-bedroom apartment built in 2010, offers contemporary high specification accommodation in the quiet sought-after location of Worth, within walking distance of Three Bridges station.The apartment which is approximately 856 sq.ft. And comprises of a communal entrance with security entry phone system which leads to private entrance hall with large storage cupboard and additional storage cupboard for a washing machine.The whole property is neutrally decorated throughout with modern lvt floors laid to all rooms and cupboards.The large living/dining room is at the front of the property which is bright and light and has double aspect windows.The kitchen is fitted with high gloss wall and base units, sink unit, roll top work surfaces over, integrated new gas hob, electric oven, integrated dishwasher and fridge/freezer, recessed spotlights. The kitchen is partly tiled.A wall mounted Worcester Bosh boiler has been installed for maximum efficiency for the running of the hot water and central heating system.The large double master bedroom has a window to the rear overlooking woodlands and a door which accesses the communal quiet rear garden. There is a double storage wardrobe.Off the master bedroom, the large en-suite comprises of a double shower cubicle, low level WC, pedestal with wash hand basin. The en-suite is partly tiled.The second bedroom is another double room with fitted wardrobe and window to rear.The family bathroom comprises of a panel enclosed bath with mixer tap and shower attachment, low level WC, pedestal wash hand basin, heated towel rail, extractor fan, recessed spotlights and partly tiled.Outside there is a car port providing allocated parking for two vehicles. There is additional visitor parking spaces on a first come first served basis.Please contact Eternity Properties Limited to arrange a viewing.Council Tax Band CEPC Band CNearby Railway Stations - Distances are straight line distancesThree Bridges 0.7 milesCrawley Station 1.8 milesIfield Station 3.0 milesEasy access to M23 motorway providing access to London, Gatwick, Brighton and surrounding areasDeposit: £1,500Holding Deposit: £346.15

description: Property Reference: 1827367.Beautiful new build flat in the flagship building in the Heart of Hale development.This 1 bed flat hugely spacious with a large and private terrace. It is situated a stones throw from Tottenham Hale Underground, Rail and Bus stations.The open-plan living area is flooded with natural light thanks to multiple floor-to-ceiling windows. The spacious kitchen is fully equipped with high-spec appliances, including a full-sized dishwasher and induction hobs, complete with ample cupboard space.The highlight of the flat is the large private terrace. It's the perfect place to relax and enjoy the outdoors, or to entertain guests! And you can enjoy stunning views of the Canary Wharf, and Stratford skylines.The flat is located less than 100m from Tottenham Hale station, making it easy to get around London and beyond, with Victoria Line tubes to Oxford Circus (16 minutes), King's Cross (11 minutes), Walthamstow (4 minutes), and direct train services to Stratford (12 minutes), Liverpool Street (14 minutes), and Stansted Airport (31 minutes).Key Features-Newly built, high-spec, huge one-bed apartment.-24hr concierge and security.-Spectacular communal areas.-100m from Tottenham Hale station, skyline views, energy efficient, pet friendly!- High-specification appliances- Huge private terrace- Welcoming, striking communal areasClose to shops, restaurants, and bars- Very easy, step-free access to public transport100m from Tottenham Hale station- Easy access to Oxford Circus, King's Cross, Stratford, Liverpool Street, and Stansted Airport- Pet friendly- Secure bike storage- 24-hour concierge and security- Lifts to all floors- Walking distance from the Walthamstow Wetlands, Tottenham Marshes, and Down Lane Park, Bevertown Brewery and Blackhorse 'beer mile' are also close byFurther information:The flat is part of an energy-efficient development, which means that your bills will be lower than in a traditional flat/house conversion. The building is well-insulated and energy-efficient. There's underfloor heating in all rooms, including the bathroom. It boasts two large built-in wardrobes and a highly effective Mechanical Ventilation with Heat Recovery unit which is a whole flat ventilation and air filtration system that both supplies and extracts air throughout the property to reduce the heating and cooling demands of flat.There are also striking communal areas, including a 5th-floor south-facing terrace, a 1st-floor garden, a triple-height entrance lobby, and shared workspaces (including free communal area WiFi) making it the ideal place to work from home.The flat is pet-friendly (subject to permit). There is secure bike storage on site, and 24-hour concierge and security. It's a short walk to the High Street, where you'll find a variety of shops, restaurants, and bars. You're also just a few minutes from Tottenham Hale retail park for your groceries, and the Walthamstow Wetlands, Tottenham Marshes, and Down Lane Park complete with tennis and all-weather football pitches. And if you're a beer lover, you'll be happy to know that Bevertown Brewery and the Blackhorse 'beer mile' are close by.Summary & Exclusions:- Rent Amount: £2,450.00 per month (£565.39 per week)- Deposit / Bond: £2,826.92- 1 Bedrooms- 1 Bathrooms- Property comes furnished- Available to move in from 01 October, 2023- Minimum tenancy term is 12 months- Maximum number of tenants is 2- Students welcome to enquire- Pets considered / by arrangement- No Smokers- Family Friendly- Bills not included- No Parking Available- Property has garden access- EPC Rating: B If calling, please quote reference: 1827367 Fees:You will not be charged any admin fees.** Contact today to book a viewing and have the landlord show you round! **Request Details form responded to 24/7, with phone bookings available 9am-9pm, 7 days a week.OpenRent endeavours to make all property particulars as accurate and reliable as possible, however if you require any further clarification or information please contact us. description: This Princes Street property is a beautifully, recently refurbished family home, ideally located in a popular and attractive residential area of Tunbridge Wells, typified by Victorian villas, and within walking distance of the mainline station, town centre and parks. It presents fantastic family accommodation, with 3 bedrooms upstairs, the largest of which has an en-suite shower room with toilet and wash basin. The open plan kitchen and dining room is a lovely bright family space with glazed doors onto the sunny garden, zoned perfectly for entertaining and children to play. On street permit parking is available.Important Information:Rent: £2,950 pcm.All utilities and rates to be covered by tenant.Term: Minimum Contract of 1 yearDeposit: 5 weeks rent - £3,404Available: December 2023During the tenancy (payable to the Agent)Payment of £50 if you want to change the tenancy agreementPayment of interest for the late payment of rent (when 14 days late or over) at a rate of 3% over Bank of England Base RatePayment of an administration fee (details in Tenancy Agreement) and actual cost of key/security device for the loss of keys/security devicesPayment of any unpaid rent or other reasonable costs associated with your early termination of the tenancyDuring the tenancy (payable to the provider) if permitted and applicable:Utilities – gas, electricity, waterCommunications – telephone and broadbandInstallation of cable/satellite (if appropriate/permitted)Subscription to cable/satellite supplierTelevision licenceCouncil Tax Band EOther permitted payments:Any other permitted payments, not included above, under the relevant legislation including contractual damages.Tenant protection:Maddisons Residential is a member of the Client Money Protect Scheme, and details may be found at .; we are also a member of The Property Ombudsman, which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on the agent’s website or by contacting the agent directly.EPC Rating: DLocationPrinces Street is a highly desirable residential road on the favoured southern side of the vibrant spa town of Tunbridge Wells. It is within walking distance of many lovely parks, including Calverley and Dunorlan and all the recreational amenities that they offer. Tunbridge Wells town centre, with its well-regarded restaurants, extensive shopping facilities and mainline station with regular services to Central London, is also within easy walking distance. There are excellent schools in the area with St Peters cep and Claremont Primary School both only a short walk away - and there are a variety of options in both the independent sector and the much sought-after Kent Grammar system. The impressive, award-winning Bluewater Shopping Centre is 30 miles away and if you want to escape to the south coast, then the lovely seaside towns are only 26 miles distant.LocationPrinces Street is a highly desirable residential road on the favoured southern side of the vibrant spa town of Tunbridge Wells. description: Bourne are pleased to present this well presented & spacious two bedroom second floor apartment. Located with in Petersfield town centre with easy access to the train station.From the entrance hallway you will find a modern kitchen with a breakfast bar and appliances. Bedroom one can be found on the left hand side of the entrance and offers a fitted wardrobe and en-suite with roll top bath. The living room is a good size, light and airy and allows access to the second bedroom which also has a fitted wardrobe. Also off the living room is another bathroom complete with bath with shower overhead.Petersfield is a market town and civil parish in the East Hampshire district of Hampshire, England. It is 15 miles north of Portsmouth.Set in the glorious countryside of the South Downs National Park, Petersfield is an ancient market town originally built as a Norman 'new town' at the end of the 11th Century. It is now a vibrant place for shopping and eating out. The town has its own railway station on the Portsmouth Direct Line, the mainline rail link connecting Portsmouth and LondonThe main square is an attractive focal point providing the perfect venue for twice weekly markets on Saturdays and Wednesdays. There is a Farmers' Market on the first Sunday of every month.EPC Rating: DCouncil Tax Band: B

You'll also find yourself near the Stock Brook Country Club, Norsey Wood nature reserve, and the charming Stock High Street with its local shops and award-winning pubs.Property Overview:This lovely property will be available at the end of September, making it an ideal choice for those seeking tranquility in the heart of Essex's picturesque countryside. description: A two bedroom Victorian semi detached property boasting an elevated position with views over countryside to the front. The property is conveniently located for West Malling High Street and gives good access to local road links including M2 and M20 Motorways.Internally the property comprises sitting room, dining room, kitchen and a conservatory. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally there is a large three tiered rear garden, mainly laid to lawn.Situated just a stones throw away from the popular village of West Malling. Close enough to the local shops, bars and restaurants as well as the station with trains into London Victoria.Available end of October.Local Information For West MallingWest Malling is one of the most attractive small towns in mid-Kent with a wide main street lined on each side by a fine collection of period properties, shops and amenities.West Malling offers an excellent range of local and specialist shops together with a mainline station serving London Victoria.The delightful parkland of Manor Park is also close by and features a lake, woodland and children’s play area.Maidstone, Tonbridge and Sevenoaks all provide an excellent and comprehensive range of educational, recreational and shopping facilities together with mainline stations serving London Bridge, Cannon Street, Charing Cross and Victoria.The M20 and M26 are easily accessible ensuring quick communications with the M25, Gatwick, Heathrow, City and Stansted airports, Canary Wharf, the Channel Tunnel and Ashford and Ebbsfleet International Stations (Ebbsfleet to St Pancras station in 17 minutes).DisclaimerAll dimensions are approximate and any floor plans are for guidance purposes only. Please make sure you carefully read and agree with the tenancy agreement and any inventory provided before signing these documents.

description: A delightful three bedroom linked detached house, with the benefit of two parking spaces to the front. A large porch as you enter with downstairs cloakroom. VAT) for the time taken replacing lost key(s) or other security device(s).- Change of Sharer: Payment of £50 (inc.VAT) per replacement tenant or any reasonable cost incurred if higher.- Early Termination: Liable to the Landlord for the costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. description: Homes Partnership Lettings & Property Management is delighted to present this desirable mid-terraced property offers a wonderful opportunity to enjoy a comfortable and contemporary living space. Boasting three spacious bedrooms and a large lounge/diner, this property offers ample space to accommodate a family or professional tenants. Currently undergoing redecoration throughout, the property will be presented in pristine condition, providing a fresh and modern look.The property further benefits from a large garden, perfect for outdoor activities and entertaining guests. The private fenced garden includes a patio area, ideal for al fresco dining, while the well-maintained lawn area offers an inviting space for children to play; this outside area enhances the overall tranquillity and privacy of the property.Conveniently situated in a quiet area, this property is enviably located just 0.2 miles from the nearest bus station, providing easy access to various amenities and transport links. Completing the package, the property also offers free parking on a first come, first serve basis.Overall, this mid-terraced property is an excellent choice for those seeking a spacious and well-maintained home with a delightful outside space. With its modern interiors, ample storage, and proximity to local amenities, this property provides comfortable and convenient living for prospective tenants. Don't miss the opportunity to make this property your own and enjoy the benefits of a peaceful and beautiful garden.EPC Rating: CLocationLocated to the south west of the town, Broadfield has one of the largest neighbourhood shopping parades in the town with a wide variety of shops, a library, a church, a nearby mosque and a large medical centre. There are two primary schools, an adventure playground, many open spaces with football pitches and the Broadfield Stadium which is home to Crawley Town Football Club. Broadfield Park is next to the stadium, this used to be part of Tilgate Estate and there is a small lake and some woods. Buchan Country Park and Tilgate Park are roughly equidistant, both with large, open spaces to relax in and K2 Leisure centre is nearby. The 24 hour Fastway bus service connects Broadfield to Crawley town centre, Gatwick Airport and beyond and the A23 / M23 provides access to London and the south coast, with Brighton only a 30 minute drive away, boasting fantastic beaches and attractions.Summary Of Charges To TenantsMoney due to reserve a property:Holding Deposit:Equivalent to 1 Weeks' Rent |Money due in cleared funds prior to the start of tenancy:One month's rent in advanceDilapidations Deposit (Equivalent to 5 weeks' rent)Material InformationRent Amount: £1600pcm |Holding Deposit Amount: £380.76 |Security Deposit Amount: £1,903.84 |Length of Initial Tenancy: 12 months (subject to negotiation) |Council Tax Band: Band C - £1,865.47

description: Avard Estate Agents are pleased to offer for let this two bedroom ground floor flat with garage and direct access to a well maintained communal rear garden forming part of this Victorian villa with a curved sweeping brick pathway rising to the grand entrance hall. The property has been beautifully updated by current vendors and must be viewed to be fully appreciated. Accommodation comprises of hallway, living room, brand new modern fitted kitchen, newly installed bathroom with shower, two double bedrooms and communal gardens.The kitchen and bathroom have the benefit of having underfloor heating. Located within the famous Golden Triangle, formerly part of the Stanford Estate.This property is situated in this highly desired residential area in this wide tree lined avenue which is located adjacent to Brighton's most dominant and renowned park, Preston Park which is, acclaimed for its authentic clock tower and vast green open area. Preston Park also hosts many facilities such as tennis courts, bowling greens, cycle velodrome, pathways for running and jogging as well as hosting multiple local and international events constantly providing unforgettable days out for all the family. This lovely flat is located less than a mile from three train stations (London Road, Preston Park and Brighton) which makes commuting to Gatwick and London an ease. Local shopping facilities are in abundance in Preston Drove and at the acclaimed Fiveways and the busy London Road which has an unmatchable amount of excellent places to eat and drink with its multitude of shops, restaurants and cafes. Local bus services are continually available nearby providing access to Brighton city centre and seafront.

description: Situated in the Heart of Hitchin's town centre just a short walk to all amenities, two bedroom third floor apartment, bright and airy living room, modern kitchen with appliances, two double bedrooms, modern bathroom, parking for one car. Available now. EPC Rating D (61)Tenancy fees do not apply unless you are a registered company. We require a holding deposit equivalent to 1 weeks agreed rent to reserve the property. On successful passing of credit checks 1 months rent (less holding deposit) and a damages deposit equivalent to 5 weeks agreed rent is required. Monthly rent will be payable per calendar month in advance. Please see website for full tenancy information.Hitchin is a charming medieval market town and has many fine Tudor and Georgian buildings, particularly around the market square. Near to the market square stands the large medieval parish church of St Mary. The town provides good shopping as well as a swimming pool, football team, two theatres, a wide variety of restaurants and pubs and highly regarded girls and boys schools. There is also a mainline railway station providing direct access to Kings Cross and Cambridge.

key_features: ['Part furnished', 'Available Soon...Date tbc', 'Seven Bedroom Detached Modern House', 'Four Bathrooms / Shower Rooms', '3,500 sq ft to include large one bedroom annex', 'Larger than average self contained one bedroom Annex', 'Flexible accommodation / Beautiful Countryside Views', 'Electric Car Charger', 'Very Spacious Kitchen / Diner / Family Room', 'Approx 0.6 Acre Plot / Pets welcome for a premium', 'Ample Parking / driveway for several vehicles']
description: Tucked away on a non-through road, 'Woodcroft' is nestled down this quiet village lane. As the electric gates rollback be prepared to be impressed by this much-improved and thoughtfully extended detached family home. Step out of your car and listen to the peace and quiet, broken only by the songs of various birds hiding in the hedgerow. Designed specifically for multi-generation living, this delightful family home has so much to offer and has to be viewed to be fully appreciated.Situated in the rarely available and sought-after hamlet of Haultwick offering a picturesque and rural setting yet under 9 miles from both Hertford and Ware town centres with all their amenities including multiple train stations with services into central London.Over 3600 sq ft of flexible accommodation, this family home, offers a five bedrooms, three reception rooms. Three bathrooms and a self contained annexe that is set out all on the ground floor. Can offered Part furnished or Unfurnished.The entrance hall gives direct access to multiple rooms and also leads into the reception hall which is cosy and welcoming. The sitting room seems to hug you as soon as you step inside.The showpiece of the house without a doubt has to be the stunning open plan, kitchen / dining / family room. As soon as you step inside it is obvious to see this really is the heartbeat of the house. Designed with true family living at the forefront, this space certainly has the wow factor, with its high vaulted ceiling, eight solar-powered Velux windows, and two sets of trii-fold doors, giving access to the rear decking area, the room is bathed in ample natural light. Quartz worktops and matching centralised workstation, large sink complete with Quooker tap which provides both filtered still and sparkling cold water and also boiling water on demand. The kitchen is ideal for those with a passion for cooking and entertaining or for those that simply have to cater to the demands of a large family. Set against large grey flagstone tiles with underfloor heating, With two double ovens, two microwaves, two dishwashers, separate fridge and freezer units, and a further wine fridge. Space for a large dining table and a further area for comfy sofas, this room offers it all.Walking through the kitchen, a door leads into a further ground floor entrance hall, family bathroom, and a large boot room, which could easily be converted into a kitchenette. A second independent staircase gives access to a large bedroom/living room. It is easy to see how this could be a self contained teenager suite / 2nd annexeReturning to the main accommodation, there is a ground floor home office, with double storage cupboard, hobby room / bedroom five with double storage cupboard, family shower room and a further fourth bedroom. The former kitchen diner is currently used as a laundry room. On the first floorThe main bedroom suite is spacious and light with views over the fields. En-suite four piece bathroom. Bedroom two is also a good size double and enjoys a dual aspect.Self contained annexeOffering direct access from the main house, or from the front driveway, this annexe is of excellent size, offering an open plan living kitchen with two windows overlooking the front, a large double bedroom with a wheelchair-friendly en-suite shower room.OutsideYou can lose yourself in the peace and quiet as you step out into the rear garden. With ample decking and raised terrace, this is ideal for family barbeques or outside entertaining with friends. The garden is predominately laid to lawn, and is not overlooked.To the side of the house there is a lockable timber shed for bike storage and further open-fronted covered storage sheds.Pets welcome for a premiumAvailable soon Date tbcNoticeAll photographs are provided for guidance only.Redress scheme provided by: Property Ombudsmen (T00533)Client Money Protection provided by: Propertymark (C0129770)

key_features: ['Furnished or unfurnished', 'Townhouse in popular gated development', 'Allocated residents parking', 'Part-furnished or unfurnished', 'Good location to access commuter routes and access to mainline stations', 'Easy access to Windsor and all it has to offer', 'EPC Rating = C']
description: Townhouse in highly desirable gated development. Set close to local amenities.DescriptionThis is a charming gated development of modern townhouses. The house offers family accommodation over three floors with underfloor heating on the ground and first floor.On the ground floor the reception hall leads to the kitchen fitted with a good range of units, integrated appliances and contrasting counter tops. The sitting/dining room is at the rear of the property and has French doors opening onto the garden terrace. A cloakroom completes this floor.On the first floor, there are two well-presented double bedrooms both with fitted wardrobes and modern en suite facilities. On the second floor, there is a further spacious bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en suite shower room.Opposite the front of the property are the two allocated parking spaces. There are also visitor spaces available. To the rear of the property the southerly facing garden is laid to lawn with a paved terrace adjoining the house making this an ideal spot for outdoor entertaining. The garden also has a side access gate.LocationCopper Horse Court is a popular gated development of modern townhouses set on Hatch Lane. Windsor is surrounded by miles of beautiful countryside yet is still within commuting distance of Central London. The various local attractions include Windsor Castle, Windsor Great Park and the Theatre Royal Windsor, Legoland, Savill Garden and Virginia Water Lake.Windsor offers a fine choice of shopping facilities, bars and restaurants.Road travel is excellent with the M4 (J6) providing access to Heathrow Airport, Central London and the West Country and also linking with the M25 and M3. Rail communications are also convenient with Windsor’s two stations, Windsor and Eton Central and Windsor and Eton Riverside, offering services to London Waterloo and London Paddington (via Slough) respectively. Crossrail, the new high-speed rail service is due to begin running in soon from slough & Maidenhead.Educational opportunities are extensive and include St. George’s Windsor Castle and Upton House in Windsor, St. George’s, St. Mary’s, Heathfield and Papplewick in Ascot, Lambrook in Winkfield Row, Eton College, Wellington College in Crowthorne and Royal Holloway in Egham.Additional InfoHolding Deposit - £553.84 (1 weeks rent)Deposit Payable - £2,769.23 (5 weeks rent)12 months minimum tenancy

description: DescriptionYour Dream Family Home Awaits!This exceptional home offers everything you've been searching for and more. With off-street parking, four spacious bedrooms, a vast garden, and even a studio-style bedroom with a kitchenette, it's the ideal haven for a growing family. But that's not all - this versatile space could also provide a comfortable retreat for an elderly relative or a teenager looking for their own independence.Modern Living Spaces: Step into the heart of the home, where a modern and well-lit kitchen welcomes you with open arms. Ample dining space, separate from the lounge, ensures your family gatherings are a breeze. A convenient downstairs WC adds to the practicality of the home. The lounge is spacious and inviting, complete with a cosy log burner, perfect for those chilly winter nights.Garden Paradise: The generously-sized garden is a green paradise, providing ample space for outdoor activities and relaxation. It even includes a separate paved area and a dedicated log store section for your convenience.Upstairs Comfort: Upstairs, you'll discover two very spacious double bedrooms, offering plenty of room for your family's needs. There's also a slightly smaller single bedroom, perfect for a child or a home office. The family bathroom features a modern (P) shaped bath with a shower, ensuring a comfortable and stylish bathing experience for all.Don't miss the chance to make this incredible family home yours. Contact us today to arrange a viewing and start envisioning the wonderful memories you'll create in this exceptional space.*please note: Due to the overwhelming volume of enquiries on each property we advertise it will take time to come back to everyone.Thank you in advance for your patience.Council Tax Band: D (Canterbury)Deposit: £1,840.38Holding Deposit: £368.07
